intro: Polygonum caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian knotweed, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
